context: The word 'peavad' is the third-person plural present indicative form of the Estonian verb 'pidama'. It means 'must', 'have to', or 'are obliged to'. This verb form indicates that a group of people (third person plural - they) have an obligation, necessity, or requirement to do something. In the example sentences, it shows that girls must go to school, they have to do homework, and children need to sleep at 10 o'clock.
